channel.title: Illustration and Design by Karen Murray | A Rose Cast
channel.description: A Rose Cast is a one-person studio producing illustration and design work for clients, both big and small, as well as a line of illustrative products ~ from art prints and stationery, to jewellery and homewares ~ sold both online and in physical stores.

item.title: My Work // Usagi Tsukino from manga/anime Sailor Moon | Watercolour & Pencil Portrait Illustration
item.description:
I’ve started doing a few flashbacks posts talking about some of my favourite pieces from my back-catalogue; first up was my fan art illustration of Willow Rosenberg from Joss Whedon’s Buffy The Vampire Slayer; then Captain Jean-Luc Picard from Star Trek: The Next Generation. And lastly I shared Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds of classic sci-fi/western Firefly. Today, it’s all about another fan art piece, this time of Usagi Tuskino from the manga/anime Sailor Moon.

I’m a big nerd; you can see that from a number of my wish list posts. I’ve been a manga and anime fan since my early teens. Although my interest has waned a little in the past few years, it still has a big place in my heart.

One of the first shows that I adored was Sailor Moon; I may have been a fair bit older than the target market, but it is a lot of fun, and the uncut Japanese versions of both the manga and anime are far darker than it looks from the outside. (Though I have to admit I haven’t watched any of Sailor Moon Crystal yet …)

After starting with a few pieces of fan art based on live action series, I wanted to create my own version of an illustrated/animated character. Usagi-chan was an obvious choice for me as I knew her hair and pose would be a lot of fun to recreate. I also wanted to play around with backgrounds a little more, adding fun watercolour effects, and felt that as a star field would be perfect for Sailor Moon, this was the perfect time.

Buy this Piece on Society6, Art Rookie,
Redbubble or Etsy

Just like Willow, Picard, Malcolm Reynolds and Princess Bubblegum, I’m really ecstatic with how she has turned out.

So I decided to pop A4 and A6 art prints up on my Etsy store, along with a greeting card version with an additional banner of text; "You’ll always be my hero". This is the perfect card to give to a friend who you’ve always admired and to whom you look up to.

I currently have five fan art illustrations in this line of art prints and greeting cards. Sailor Moon is joined by; Joss Whedon creations Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds from the short-lived sci-fi/western classic Firefly, and Willow Rosenberg from Buffy The Vampire Slayer; Captain Picard from sci-fi epic Star Trek: The Next Generation; and Princess Bubblegum from the animated show Adventure Time (though she still needs the greeting card treatment).

And like most of my products, you can also buy the Usagi Tsukino / Sailor Moon illustration on a number different products over on my Society6, Redbubble and Art Rookie stores, from cushions and cards to mugs and rugs.

item.title: Friday Favourites
item.description:
A few little things I've come across this week that I'm loving.

1. Feminist Black Cat Enamel Pin

Cats and feminism are always a winning combination for me. This cat wants equality right meow. Show her off on your jacket, bag or hat.

2. Pro Cats Enamel Pin from Punky Pins

And another mix of feline cuteness and equality politics. I actually treated myself to this enamel pin a few weeks back.

3. 10 More Things to do in New York

It’s been two years now since I visited New York and I’m hoping to head back again at some point in the future. So having a fun list of places to go and eat is always a good thing.

4. 20 Different Eyeliner Styles Liquid Eyeliner

I’m not very adventurous when it comes to make-up, so would love to try out a few of these playful styles on a night out. Or maybe even use them on a few of my illustrated girls.

5. Taro & Black Sesame Ice Cream Recipe

I love Asian desserts, so the thought of ice cream with sesame and taro sounds great to me. I haven’t made ice cream at all this summer, so should probably give this a try.

6. Me & Orla on Instagram

I attended an Instagram photography class by Sara at Blogtacular in back in June and loved her tips, and her Instagram is so beautiful and restful.

7. DIY Pocket Hanging Organiser

I’m finally getting my office sorted so am looking for a few finishing touches. Loving this DIY pocket organiser.

8. DIY Copper Inspiration Board

And this copper wire inspiration board. I think something like this could also work well for display when I hold my first stall in October.

item.title: My Work // Custom Watercolor & Calligraphy Wedding Stationery Suites
item.description:
I've just released three wedding stationery suites over on my Etsy store. Each comes with a Save the Date card, an Invitation card and a RSVP card, all with watercolour illustrations on both the front and back; a tiered wedding cake topped with flowers, a vintage convertible car and a wreath with wedding bands / rings, flowers and succulents.

Not only do these suites come with the watercolour illustrations and custom text, but in each case the names of the bride(s)/groom(s) will be custom designed in calligraphy and hand-painted for every order to personalise each suite.

Buy on

I’m really happy with how each of the three have turned out, but my definite favourite is the vintage car suite. It was also the most fun to paint! And I have a few more designs coming.

So if you are getting married any time soon and are looking for an affordable way to purchase some custom watercolour and calligraphy wedding stationery, please check these designs out.

item.title: Month in Review // June & July 2016
item.description:
A lot of my work over the past little while has been a bit more behind the scenes (to be released over the next few months), so some of the 'new' things I've released have been older work.

I’m also playing around with what I post here on the blog, introducing a new Friday Faves column, and making Loved Links, Creative Spotlight and Wish List a little less regular. I’m hoping that over the next few months, I’ll be posting more of my own content here (not just products), but for now, onto what June and July has meant for me.

New Creations

  • Illustration, Stationery & Jewellery Project // Clio - Watercolour Illustration of a Pink & Blue Haired Girl with Stars
  • Illustration Project // Fan Art of Captain Jean-Luc Picard, from sci-fi epic Star Trek: The Next Generation
  • Jewellery Project // Cats. Books. Life is Good - Watercolour Illustration on a Wooden Brooch of a Blue Tabby Reading a Book
  • Illustration Project // Fan Art of Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds of Joss Whedon’s classic sci-fi/western Firefly

Day in the Life

The lovely Made by Mrs M featured me in her Day in the Life column. If you want to see what I do on a typical day and my process for creating new illustration work, go have a little read. Thank you so much, Kate for featuring me!

What I’ve been Loving and Lusting Over

  • Wish List // 6 Places to Buy Lovely Notebooks & Notepads
  • Loved Linked // 6 Colour-Filled & Playful Printables for Summer Parties & Get Togethers
  • Creative Spotlight // 6 Wonderful illustrators to Follow on Instagram
  • You can see more of the things I love over on my Pinterest

Friday Favourites // More Great Links from the Web

  • Friday 27th May // Fashion nerds, unicorns and matcha.
  • Friday 3rd June // Rocky Horror, Tokyo indie guide and gummy bears.
  • Friday 1st July - The Blogtacular Goodie Bag // Goodies from wonderful small businesses.
  • Friday 8th July // Peonies, pastel pinks and water gardens.
  • Friday 15th July // Cute dogs, architectural brooches, and how to be yourself.
  • Friday 22nd July // Stolen art, tiny embroidery and cacti.

Snapshots

  • A rose gold and wood necklace version of my I feel Pretty illustration, based on my ginger tom, Toby
  • My current line of birthday and congrats greeting cards, available on Etsy
  • A new birthday card design of girl with purple-blue ombre hair. Can’t wait to add this piece to the listing above!
  • Blue door, pink house in Notting Hill, that I came across on our Blogtacular photo walk around west London
  • Monty caught using my book as a pillow, once again …
  • He has a thing for books, so I created this wooden brooch as an ode to the rascal
  • Keep up to date by following me on Instagram

Other Happenings This Month

  • Reading // The Hundred-Year-Old Man Who Climbed Out of the Window and Disappeared by Jonas Jonasson. I picked up this one when I was at Daunt Books (sooooo pretty!) back in February, and I’m loving it. Though I’ve made slow progress as I just don’t seem to be making enough time to read this month sigh (Follow me on Goodreads)
  • Watching // Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt. It’s a Tiny Fey show, so a must watch for me. I think it took me a few episodes to get into, but now I’m really loving it. I’m so happy Carol Kane plays such a big part as she was one of the first kooky personalities on TV and film I connected to as a kid in the 80s. And that intro is too damn catchy.
  • Listening // Nothing new this month! But I’ve gone back to listening to some of my fave Japanese artists, such as folk rock singer Cocco (Official English Site).
  • Playing // I really need to get started on a new game …
  • Eating // Trying to get myself to like natto. If you know anything about this food, you’ll understand.
  • Learning // Yoga, in order to focus on strength and balance.
  • Doing // Creating a proper shop for this site! Hopefully this will be live soon.

item.title: My Work // Day in the Life
item.description:
The lovely Made by Mrs M has featured me in her Day in the Life column. If you want to see what I do on a typical day and my process for creating new illustration work, go have a little read.

Thank you so much, Kate for featuring me!

item.title: Friday Favourites
item.description:
A few little things I've come across this week that I'm loving.

1. Tiny Embroidery by ipnot on Instagram

Loving these amazing little pieces of embroidery by Japanese artist ipnot, including these adorable cats.

2. Matcha No Bake Cheesecakes

I love anything with matcha, and these chesscakes, made with matcha Pocky, look particularly yummy.

3. Beautiful Artwork by Korean illustrator/Artist Mi-Kyung Choi, a.k.a. Ensee

I love drawing lovely women and girls in pastel tones, so these awe-inspiring digital paintings by illustrator Ensee really captured my attention.

4. Fun & Colorful Summer Tech Wallpapers by Caytlyn Chilellit

Bring a little summer cheer to your tech devices with these wonderful wallpapers by Caytlyn Chilellit of push print studio.

5. Shop the Stolen Art

I'm sure a number of you have heard about retailer ZARA's stealing of independent designers work, and their horrid response. You can find out more and buy the original designs here. Support small!

6. DIY Coloured Plaster Mini Planters

My succulents have been sprouting chicks, and I also have a collection of leaves producing new plants, so I need more pots. Maybe I should make a few of these?

item.title: Wish List // 6 Places to Buy Lovely Notebooks & Notepads
item.description:
Who else is a stationery addict? I have so many notebooks, but still lust after buying even more. I should actually just sit down and use the ones I have so I can occasionally treat myself to a replacement, but I always have a hard time marking their pretty pages.

Here are a few of my favourites notebooks at the moment. These wonderful designers and illustrators are inspiring me to design a few notebooks for my own products.

1. Notebooks by Papio Press

From foxes and bull dogs to unicorns and tigers, Papio Press have a massive range of absolutely gorgeous notebooks. I've bought from them before, and the creators behind the company are just incredibly lovely as well.

2. Notebooks by OH NO RACHIO!

I love Rachel's work (I treated myself to her constellation moon phase enamel pin a little while back) and I think these kraft notebooks with white ink illustrations and lettering are really beautiful pieces.

3. Cat Inspired Notebooks from ilikecats

I have a hard time not including cats somewhere in my posts. I've loved the stuff produced by Toby of ilikecats for a long time, and these notebooks are no exception.

4. Grand Budapest Hotel Notebook by FamilyTree

I'm a massive Wes Anderson fan, and when The Grand Budapest Hotel came out, it felt like he had made a movie that gathered all my greatest loves together into one celluloid dream. So I would love this little notebook to carry around.

5. Notepads on Etsy by Quill and Fox

These quaint illustrated notepads and to-do lists from Quill and Fox come in a few different themes, from flowers and plants, to animals and this little book club version. They all evoke a welcome sense of nostalgia and a quiet softness.

6. Library To Do Desk Notepad by Idlewild

One of many ways to make me lust after a product is to give a library theme. This deskplanner, with illustrations of a globe, books and indoor plants, is adorable. It’s sized to sit on your desk, and, with 52 sheets, it helps you plan the whole year out (like my vintage glasses weekly planner.)

item.title: My Work // Malcolm 'Mal' Reynolds of Joss Whedon's Firefly | Watercolour & Pencil Portrait Illustration
item.description:
I’ve started doing a few flashbacks posts talking about some of my favourite pieces from my back-catalogue; first up was my fan art illustration of Willow Rosenberg from Joss Whedon’s Buffy The Vampire Slayer; then I shared Captain Jean-Luc Picard from Star Trek: The Next Generation. Today, it’s all about another fan art piece, this time of Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds of Joss Whedon’s classic sci-fi/western Firefly.

I’m a big nerd; you can see that from a number of my wish list posts. I came to Firefly a little late. I had heard about it around the time it was first released, but knowing it had been suddenly cancelled, I didn’t look too much into it. A few years later, its popularity had exploded, especially with the release of the movie. So I rented the first DVD to check it out. I don’t think I got around to renting the second DVD as I went straight to buying the box set.

It’s an immense shame to see such a great show cut down just when it had barely begun. But despite having only 14 episodes and a movie, it is one of the most respected sci-fi shows of the past few decades due to its mixing of varied genres, flawed characters and stellar writing.

So I felt I should do a little ode to the show and one of its greatest characters, Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds, brilliantly portrayed by Nathan Fillion. And just like Willow and Picard, I was really ecstatic with how he turned out.

Buy this Piece on Society6, Art Rookie,
Redbubble or Etsy

I’ve popped A4 and A6 art prints of Mal up on my Etsy store, along with a greeting card version with the additional banner of text, "You Little Rebel You". It makes for a great greeting card to give to a nerdy friend.

I currently have five fan art illustrations in this line of art prints and greeting cards. Malcolm ‘Mal’ Reynolds is joined by; Captain Picard from the sci-fi epic Star Trek: The Next Generation; Willow Rosenberg from Joss Whedon’s Buffy The Vampire Slayer; Usagi Tsukino from the manga/anime Sailor Moon; and Princess Bubblegum from the animated show Adventure Time (though she still needs the greeting card treatment).

And like most of my products, you can also buy the Captain Jean-Luc Picard illustration on a number different products over on my Society6, Redbubble and Art Rookie stores, from cushions and cards to mugs and rugs.

item.title: Friday Favourites
item.description:
A few little things I've come across this week that I'm loving.

1. Cute Dogs & Pastels on Runnerkimhall's Instagram Account

I’m a big lover of pastels, so runnerkimhall's Instagram account is a joy to follow. So many playful photos with beautiful pastel colourscapes. Plus, a stinkingly adorable dog!

6. Products Inspired by Brutalist Architecture & Mid-Century Design

I met Kate while I was in London for the Blogtacular conference. I’m a big fan of architecture and illustrated buildings, so I really adore her products. To anyone who loves brutalist or mid-century design, I think you’ll find more than a few things to love on her shop and blog.

3. DIY Mini Mountain Photo Holders

I have my first stall at a convention in Belfast this October, so I’m looking for cheap but effective ways to display my products. I think these little mountain photo holders would look great on my table.

4. Anti-Socialite Lips Enamel Pin

I’ve been loving Bouffants & Broken Hearts patterns for a while now, so was delighted to find she’s released this yellow and pink Anti-Socialite lips enamel pin.

5. How to be Yourself

I love these pieces of advice from artist and author Adam J. Kurtz for working creatives. I think finding your style is one of the hardest things facing creatives. I'm still at a point where I'm testing the waters of where I want A Rose Cast to go in terms of style and content, but I'm getting there! (I think …)

2. Keiko Lynn & Miku Photo Shot

Sponsor posts are becoming much more of a regular thing on blogs. Sometimes you can tell when they are forced; I find myself just quickly strolling by these. I love Keiko Lynn's take on them; even if you aren’t interested in the product featured or in the post topic, you can still get behind the whimsical photos. And, well, cute dogs are always a win, aren't they?

item.title: Friday Favourites
item.description:
A few little things I've come across this week that I'm loving.

1. Cinnamon Cream Cheese Coffee Cake

This recipe had me at coffee cake, but cream cheese as well? Yum!

2. Kitty Teabag Wrapper

I love DIYs that help elevate a simple present into something much more special. And when it's cat-themed, that just makes it even better.

3. Colorful Peonies Wallpaper Download

Everyone love peonies. At least that's what you would think if you spent more than a few seconds on Pinterest. Dress up your tech with these gorgeous peony photographic wallpapers.

4. Pastel Pinks in Mexico City

Loving this post, but in particular I'm drawn to the goreous pastel pink buildings, stunning under the Mexican sun.

5. Beautiful Photography of Shibuya, Tokyo

I spent Halloween last year in Shibuya, and am missing it, as well as the rest of Japan, immensely. These photographs by Nguan capture the ward perfectly.

6. DIY Indoor Water Garden

Such a lovely and simple water garden using a nice jar, aquarium stones/pebbles and a few aquatic plants. Think I'll make one of these for my office (when I get around to sorting my shelving out!)
